an11.10:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, at the monastery of the wanderers in the peacocks’ feeding ground.
an11.10:1.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
an11.10:2.1: “Mendicants, a mendicant who has three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:2.3: The entire spectrum of an adept’s ethics, immersion, and wisdom.
an11.10:2.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:3.1: A mendicant who has another three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:3.3: A demonstration of psychic power, a demonstration of revealing, and a demonstration of instruction.
an11.10:3.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:4.1: A mendicant who has another three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:4.3: Right view, right knowledge, and right freedom.
an11.10:4.4: A mendicant with these three qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:5.1: A mendicant who has two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:5.4: A mendicant with these two qualities has reached the ultimate end, the ultimate sanctuary, the ultimate spiritual life, the ultimate goal. They are best among gods and humans.
an11.10:5.5: Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra also spoke this verse:
an11.10:6.2: who take clan as the standard.
an11.10:6.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
an11.10:6.4: is first among gods and humans.’
an11.10:7.1: Now, that verse spoken by Brahmā Sanaṅkumāra is well spoken, not poorly spoken. It’s beneficial, not pointless, and I agree with it.
an11.10:8.2: who take clan as the standard.
an11.10:8.3: But one accomplished in knowledge and conduct
an11.10:8.4: is first among gods and humans.’”
